intro: Camelina sativa subsp. rumelica, commonly known as the European camelina, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The seeds are small and oval, often used for oil extraction and as a source of nutrients.
